title: Himachal Rain: At Least 5 Dead And 50 Missing After Cloudburst In State, All Schools Closed In Mandi | Updates
text: - By [Anushka Vats](/authors/anushka-vats) - Published: Fri, 02 Aug 2024 08:04 AM (IST) - Source:JND Rain wreaked havoc in the hilly states of Himachal Pradesh on Wednesday night and Thursday. At least five people were killed and nearly 50 went missing following several incidents of cloudburst in the states. The rain washed away many houses, bridges and roads in different areas of the state. The state emergency operation centre said the cloudbursts took place in Nirmand, Sainj and Malana areas in Kullu, Padhar in Mandi and Rampur in Shimla districts. Let's take look at all the latest updates: - 29 out of 33 people, who were stranded in the Malana 1 Power Project located along the Manikarna Valley in #Kullu district due to waterlogging following a cloudburst, have been rescued, said Torul S Raveesh, Deputy Commissioner, Kullu. "A combined team of NDRF, Home Guard and Police QRT reached the spot by foot at the road has been blocked. Commendably, the team rescued 29 people who were stuck in different building near Malana 1. Four people are stuck inside an underground tunnel in the powerhouse. Attempts are being made to rescue them. We are in touch with them," Raveesh informed. (Army forces deployed for the rescue operation after a cloudburst occurred at the Samej Khad in the Rampu region, in Shimla on Thursday; ANI image) - In view of the warning of heavy rain on August 2, the Deputy Commissioner has declared holiday in all the educational institutions of Mandi district. - The dam of the power project broke in Malana of Manikaran valley of Kullu district. Due to this a temple and some houses were washed away. - At least 15 vehicles were buried due to a landslide in Chamba. Due to the rising water level of the Parvati river, the vegetable market building was washed away in Manikaran's Shat. - The increased water level of the Beas river damaged the Chandigarh-Manali national highway was damaged at many places leading to the closure of the roads. - A cloudburst near Shrikhand Mahadev on Wednesday night triggered flash floods in Sarpara, Ganvi and Kurban nallahs, as a result, the water in Samej Khud in Shimla district's Rampur rose, leaving two people dead and about 30 missing, Shimla Superintendent of Police Sanjeev Kumar Gandhi told PTI. - The swelling of Samej Khud resulted in havoc in Shimla and Kullu districts. (The NDRF team conduct a rescue operation after a cloudburst in the Samej Khad of Rampur area in Shimla on Thursday; ANI image) - A resident of Kullu's Malana village, Maini Devi (32) said, "Around 3 am, there was a huge sound from the Malana Dam site downstream and in the morning we got to know that it was breached." - The road connectivity to Malana village is cut off, triggering people to go hoarding the essential commodities causing the village shops to go dry, she added.
